metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29985 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in media channels could have led to memorycorruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affectsThunderbird < 78.13, Thunderbird < 91, Firefox ESR < 78.13, and Firefox <91.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29985` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 91.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '91.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
